page.title: 20COMPTON BASSETT NEAR CALNE
page.content: The Henage family owned the village for more than 200 years, until it was bought by the Co-op which sold it to the villagers in 1930.They had to buy their own houses or move away from the village.The population is now about 300.The church is the oldest building, being 800 years old.It has a screen and a half hour glass to time the sermon.One of the oldest cottages was built in 1642.The school was closed in 1963. There is a small shop which is also the Post Office and sells everything you need.A bus service connects Compton Bassett with Calne, Swindon and Devizes.Farmland surrounds the village and many people work on the farms. Some used to go into Calne to work in Harrises before it closed.The school had a wood behind it and the children used to play a game called "Fox and Hound" like tag.
